TopicTitle: KASDA mission log | Y108, D327 | Endgame: escaping Eve, conclusion (FINAL MISSION)

Articles.Content:
Mission 162: Topaz-2 (Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 4)

The WiM-10 miner/probe bus continues its exploration in the Sarnus system with visits to Hale and Eeloo.

Y44, D324 (Ovok departure)
Y44, D328 (Hale insertion)
Y44, D329 (Topaz-2b orbiter)
Y44, D330 (Topaz-2b lander, Hale departure)
Y44, D332 (Eeloo insertion, Topaz-2c orbiter and lander)

Leaving Ovok, with only a few m/s spent

Spoiler

Hale insertion (getting here was a little finicky; without time acceleration, your encounter will drift away in a matter of seconds)

Topaz-2b orbiter deployed (ore map) - because the decoupler was enough to put this on an escape trajectory, the main ship was put on a sub-orbital trajectory before detaching

Topaz-2b lander deployed

Landed on Hale with its low gravity (screenshot taken a few hours after landing)

[this was even more finicky - you have to make sure that you're on the surface (by pressing F3) before you time accelerate; otherwise, you're in orbit and you crash into the moon.]

Just a couple of m/s to leave Hale

Arrival at Eeloo

Topaz-2c orbiter (ore map)

Topaz-2c lander deployed

Landed near Eeloo's north pole (screenshot taken about 2 days after landing)

 

Edited June 13, 2019 by Pipcard

Mission 162: Topaz-2 (Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 4)

Arriving at the final two moons of Sarnus: Slate and Tekto.

Y44, D336 (Eeloo departure)
Y44, D339 (Slate insertion, Topaz-2d orbiter)
Y44, D340 (Topaz-2d lander)
Y44, D342 (Slate departure)
Y44, D356 (Eeloo insertion, Topaz-2e orbiter and lander)

Eeloo escape

Spoiler

Slate encounter

Topaz-2d orbiter (ore map)

Topaz-2d lander jettisoned

De-orbit - similar to Tylo

(few hours after landing)

Departing Slate

Arriving at Tekto

Topaz-2e orbiter over the thick, green atmosphere (ore map [had to disable the visual overhaul to see this])

Releasing the final probe

No entry heating was experienced

Aurora in the upper atmosphere

Under a very thick atmosphere for a small moon

(WiM-10 was now free to return to Ovok.)

 

Edited June 13, 2019 by Pipcard
Will WiM-10 return to Kerbin? If so, how?

6 minutes ago, Kerballing (Got Dunked On) said:

Will WiM-10 return to Kerbin? If so, how?

It's going to stay in the Sarnus system as a refueler for future missions.
Cool! So, what's the next mission in the docket? Colonize Laythe?

Loving it. Scatterer did make Sarnus look so good. 

Just wish I had the time for outer planets...

7 hours ago, Kerballing (Got Dunked On) said:

Cool! So, what's the next mission in the docket? Colonize Laythe?

Colonize Dres, actually.

17 hours ago, Pipcard said:

Colonize Dres, actually.

...

 

*cough* #fakedres *cough*

 

Good luck!

Mission 172: WiM-14

Propellant depot based on the WiM-13 architecture, but with two engines instead of twelve, no legs, and no mining equipment. This depot (about 500 km above Kerbin's surface) ensures availability of propellant even if the miner is staying for weeks at Minmus.

(81770 kg at launch, 470270 kg full; Kappa-2 launch vehicle)

Y45, D1 (launch)

WiM-14 (right) docked to WiM-13 (left)

Edited June 16, 2019 by Pipcard

45 Kerb-years of SPOOCE! Big milestone, and 50 is right around the corner!

Edited June 17, 2019 by Kerballing (Got Dunked On)
Autocorrect, dang you!

Mission 173: Iwahoshi Maru

An interplanetary transport intended for Dres colonization. Unlike the separate Duna colonization ships, this combines crew and cargo transport capabilities.

(117065 kg; Kappa-2 launch vehicle)

Y45, D100 (launch)

Spoiler

Launcher with long fairing

Refueling at WiM-14 (sorry, forgot to put the flag on both sides)
So, @Pipcard, I notice that all of your motherships (and a couple mentions in HSS, too) have "Maru" in the name. Is this Japanese for something, or do you use it because you like the sound it?

Just now, Kerballing (Got Dunked On) said:

So, @Pipcard, I notice that all of your motherships (and a couple mentions in HSS, too) have "Maru" in the name. Is this Japanese for something, or do you use it because you like the sound it?

Just a ship-naming convention.
Wow, that was fast. Interesting though! There more ya know, am I right?

Mission 174: Taiko Base modules 01+02 (MIKU-18+19), WiM-15, Song Princess 12a/b/c

First Dres base modules, a surface miner, and three comsats. All at once.

(52376 kg; Kappa-2 launch vehicle)

Mission 175: Negi Star flight 18

Chadely, Tanchelle, Corner, Kerti, Burzer, and Teuki Kerman will become the first to live on Dres.

Y45, D139 (cargo launch)
Y45, D155 (crew launch)

Mission 176: Iwahoshi Maru flight 01 (Part 1, Part 2)

Y45, D166 (Kerbin -> Dres burn)
Y46, D146 (estimated Dres insertion)

Trajectory after course correction

 

Edited June 27, 2019 by Pipcard

Mission 177: WiM-16

A miner (identical to WiM-13) being sent to Urlum, but not before docking with a multi-probe cluster.

(122775 kg at launch; K-2 launch vehicle)

(From now on, I'm just going to call these rockets "K" instead of "Kappa.")

Y45, D280 (launch)

Docked in front of the WiM-14 propellant depot

 

Mission 178: Aquamarine (Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 4)

Third batch of the outer planet "jewel" probes, to be docked to WiM-16 before transferring to Urlum. Five pairs of orbiters and landers (or an atmospheric probe) for the ice giant and its moons (Polta, Priax, Wal, and Tal).

(15881 kg; K-1b launch vehicle)

Y45, D300 (launch)
Y45, D319 (Kerbin -> Urlum burn)
Y51, D351 (estimated Urlum insertion)

Spoiler

[I couldn't use the launch vehicle fairing because it was being very buggy today. When I did, the assembly looked like this (after fairing jettison)]

Initial trajectory plan

27-minute burn

After course correction

 

Edited October 7, 2019 by Pipcard

[I am not going to show pictures of the return trips for routine interplanetary freighters from now on. Just dates.]

Y46, D49 (Nozomi Maru Duna [Ike] -> Kerbin)
Y46, D263 (estimated Nozomi Maru Kerbin insertion)

Mission 179: Negi Star flight 19

Second Duna habitation crew (Hansey, Gixie, Tanie, Donry, Heltris, Urliana)

Y46, D139 (Tachi Maru Kerbin -> Duna)

Mission 176: Iwahoshi Maru flight 01 (Part 1, Part 2)

Establishment of Taiko Base and comsat network with Chadely, Tanchelle, Corner, Kerti, Burzer, and Teuki Kerman.

Y46, D146 (Iwahoshi Maru Dres insertion)
Y46, D149 (Taiko Base established)

LKO population: 24
Mun population: 12
Minmus population: 12
Ike population: 6
Duna population: 6
Dres population: 0 -> 6

Dres orbit insertion

Spoiler

The WiM-7 miner docked with the ship

Base module undocking

All modules and WiM-15 landed near the first landing site, the best locale on Dres [for the miner, I had to transfer some fuel from one of the extra landers, the delta-v calculation was buggy]

Deploying the first Song Princess 12 comsat [maybe I should have done this first]

All satellites deployed

Finally, landing the crew

The first Kerbals to live on Dres, establishing Taiko Base

The spare Dres lander is undocked, along with the WiM-7 miner (with an extra propellant tank attached)

 

Edited July 10, 2019 by Pipcard

Mission 181: Sarnus Rabbit 1 + 2

Sarnus Rabbit 1 is a lander designed for the moons of Sarnus without an atmosphere. It has a fully enclosed cabin unlike the exposed command seat of the Jool Rabbit 1. To land on Slate, it has a crasher stage that will jettison before the soft landing.

Sarnus Rabbit 2 is intended for Tekto, like Jool Rabbit 2 was for Laythe. Tekto has lower gravity, so only one aerospike is needed instead of two.

(62735 kg at launch; K-2 launch vehicle)

Y46, D300 (launch)

Preparing to load the Negi Maru

Spoiler

Landers detached

The large docking port attached to the Sarnus Rabbit 2 was re-attached to the K-2 upper stage, so no debris was left in orbit.

[I should have left the engine shroud off, but functionally it did not cause any problems because everything just clips.]

Everything docked

 

Edited July 9, 2019 by Pipcard

Mission 180: Tachi Maru flight 03 (Part 1, Part 2)

Hansey, Gixie, Tanie, Donry, Heltris, and Urliana become the second crew to live on Duna (Akagi Base)

Y46, D331 (Duna insertion)
Y46, D333 (Arrival of crew at base)

LKO population: 24
Mun population: 12
Minmus population: 12
Ike population: 6
Duna population: 6 -> 12
Dres population: 6

Spoiler

Duna Rabbit 4 returns to orbit

Docked with the Tachi Maru

Walking from the lander to the base, a few hundred meters away

[Used EVA Follower]

Duna now has 12 kerbals living on the surface.

[By the way, I got rid of the KIS grappling hooks/anchors. They kept becoming debris and losing their effective grip. I let the base settle into a stable position; some wheels had to break.]

 

Edited July 10, 2019 by Pipcard
Sometimes you just gotta bust some wheels!

Mission 182: Negi Star flight 20 (Part 1, Part 2)

Camlorf, Tiella, Anelle, Thomwell, Julphia, Negy, Agaselle, and Lisliana lift off for the first crewed Sarnus expedition.

Y46, D345 (launch)

With RTGs replacing the fuel cell, this spaceplane will remain in orbit until the crew returns.

Mission 183: Project DIVA F 3rd / Negi Maru flight 03 (Part 1, Part 2, Part 3, Part 4, Part 5, Part 6, Part 7, Part 8)

Designing Interplanetary Vehicle Architecture with Fission propulsion, 3rd mission. Sarnus 5 expedition with 8 Kerbals - going twice as far as Jool.

Y46, D357 (departure)
Y50, D240 (course correction)
Y51, D164 (estimated Sarnus orbit insertion)

The burn was about 23 simulated minutes, and involved a massive plane change.

Spoiler

Trajectory after burn. Course correction will take place about 3.7 years, and Sarnus insertion will occur in about 4.5 years.

 

Edited October 22, 2019 by Pipcard

Y48, D132 (Tachi Maru Duna -> Kerbin)

Y48, D165 (Iwahoshi Maru Kerbin insertion)

A Munar Anomaly

Y48, D168

An anomaly was discovered on the Mun, just a few hundred kilometers from Hope Base 2. Katdi, Miruki, Giechelle, Engar, Bildard, Kerigh decided to investigate, taking off in Moon Rabbit 4.

(spoiler for easter egg below)

Spoiler

Arriving at the site. The lander overshot it, but was able to make a short hop over.

The anomaly turned out to be a memorial of unknown origin, to someone who had been to the Mun long before they did. They knew it was of great importance.

They returned home safely, while contemplating the origins of that lander sculpture, and that flag...

 

Edited July 21, 2019 by Pipcard

Mission 184: Akagi Base modules 06+07 (MIKU-20+21) + Duna Land Cruiser

The next set of modules for the Duna base, along with a large scientific rover (capable of much longer ranges and higher speeds compared to the rover on the first crewed Duna mission).

(42993 kg; K-2 launch vehicle)

Mission 185: Nozomi Maru flight 04

Y48, D195 (module launch)
Y48, D216 (Nozomi Maru Kerbin -> Duna)
Y48, D419 (Nozomi Maru Duna insertion)

Meanwhile:

Y48, D345 (Tachi Maru Kerbin insertion)

Spoiler

Launch configuration

Duna insertion

Current status of Akagi Base

[I'm not really going to do anything with the rover right now. Just pretending that the base crew has a practical long-range exploration vehicle.]

Edited July 29, 2019 by Pipcard
Really impressive thread ever since it began, and quite a lot of good stuff recently :).  I feel sorry for the crew condemned to Dres, though.

14 minutes ago, Geschosskopf said:

Really impressive thread ever since it began, and quite a lot of good stuff recently :).  I feel sorry for the crew condemned to Dres, though.

At least they live near the most interesting part.
